intro: Mediolobivia costata, commonly known as the ribbed spurge, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive ribbed stems and lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Mediolobivia costata is noted for its resilience to drought and its ability to propagate through both seeds and vegetative means.
